TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MethodData extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains information about a WMI method.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example lists information about the **Win32_Process.Create** method using the <xref:System.Management.MethodData> class. For more information on the **Win32_Process** class, see the [Windows Management Instrumentation](/windows/desktop/wmisdk/wmi-start-page) documentation.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property InParameters As ManagementBaseObject
public: property System::Management::ManagementBaseObject ^ InParameters { System::Management::ManagementBaseObject ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the input parameters to the method. Each parameter is described as a property in the object. If a parameter is both in and out, it appears in both the and properties.
Docs.value: Returns a containing the input parameters to the method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each parameter in the object should have an ID qualifier, identifying the order of the parameters in the method call.
## Property Value A <xref:System.Management.ManagementBaseObject> containing all the input parameters to the method.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
## Examples The following example lists information about the **Win32_Process.Create** method using the <xref:System.Management.MethodData> class. For more information about the **Win32_Process** class, see the [Windows Management Instrumentation](/windows/desktop/wmisdk/wmi-start-page) documentation.

Docs.value: Returns a value containing the name of the method.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Origin As String
public: property System::String ^ Origin { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the management class in which the method was first introduced in the class inheritance hierarchy.
Docs.value: Returns a value containing the name of the class in which the method was first introduced in the class inheritance hierarchy.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Property Value A string representing the originating management class name.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property OutParameters As ManagementBaseObject
public: property System::Management::ManagementBaseObject ^ OutParameters { System::Management::ManagementBaseObject ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the output parameters to the method. Each parameter is described as a property in the object. If a parameter is both in and out, it will appear in both the and properties.
Docs.value: Returns a containing the output parameters for the method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each parameter in this object should have an ID qualifier to identify the order of the parameters in the method call.
The **ReturnValue** property is a special property of the <xref:System.Management.ManagementBaseObject> returned by the <xref:System.Management.MethodData.OutParameters%2A> property and holds the return value of the method.
## Property Value A <xref:System.Management.ManagementBaseObject> containing all the output parameters to the method.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
## Examples The following example lists information about the **Win32_Process.Create** method using the <xref:System.Management.MethodData> class. For more information on the **Win32_Process** class, see the [Windows Management Instrumentation](/windows/desktop/wmisdk/wmi-start-page) documentation.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Qualifiers As QualifierDataCollection

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of qualifiers defined in the method. Each element is of type and contains information such as the *qualifier* name, value, and *flavor*.
Docs.value: Returns a containing the qualifiers for the method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
## Property Value A <xref:System.Management.QualifierDataCollection> containing the qualifiers for this method.
## .NET Framework Security Full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
## Examples The following example lists information about the **Win32_Process.Create** method using the <xref:System.Management.MethodData> class.
